channel.title: TVs, Tvs, oh TVs
channel.description:
Well Ive decided to buy a new tv, but I am not sure what brand to buy from.... This tv will mostly be used for games, and being used as my computer monitor. Computer monitor you say? Yes... Who wouldn't want a 50+ inch tv that you could also use as your fucking computer monitor?
Ok... Now back to the topic, I am not sure what to look for in tvs, Ive never really read up into tvs so my knowledge of them is less then it should be.... I am thinking of buying it from either Sams Club (As I work their now... :P) or Tigerdirect... But I am open to other places....
If I didn't already ask the question by now sorry.... So here it is if I didn't say it in my rambling above.... I am looking to buy a tv for my room, but I have shit knowledge when it comes to tvs, so I am wondering what you guys suggest as a tv for me to buy, I am looking for at least a 50+ inch tv that also comes rich in connections so I can connect all my shit. :)

item.title: TVs, Tvs, oh TVs
item.dc:creator: @mona_lisa mona lisa
item.description:
@mona_lisa wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:14, topic:415483”][quote author=Newty link=topic=517432.msg3758514#msg3758514 date=1316667425]
Where the hell did you get the cash for a 50 inch tv?? lol
[/quote]

I am either going to save up or do a payment plan. ;)[/quote]

check out www.aarons.com its rent to own any and everything. no credit check had pretty low payment plans.

Read full topic

item.title: TVs, Tvs, oh TVs
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

idk what ur price range is but:

LED: http://www.samsung.com/us/video/tvs/UN55D6000SFXZA - 55"
better but ~2x price - http://www.samsung.com/us/video/tvs/UN55D8000YFXZA

Plasma: http://www.samsung.com/us/video/tvs/PN51D530A3FXZA - 51"
better but >price - http://www.samsung.com/us/video/tvs/PN51D8000FFXZA

LCD: http://www.samsung.com/us/video/tvs/LN46D630M3FXZA - 46"

u can look around here: http://www.samsung.com/us/video/tvs/all-products then look for that model u like for a lower price else where.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“jmood128, post:9, topic:415483”]http://www.samsclub.com/sams/shop/product.jsp?productId=prod1630486&navAction=push&_requestid=151539

Yeah, looks pretty nice…

But just to be sure, do some research on it, see if it has any common defects, etc. Good quality, so on so forth, but overall, it looks really good, considering its a Vizio
